info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 5:23PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central San Juan and east central Kane Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 523 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 22 miles southwest of Halls Crossing, or 37 miles northeast of Page, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Powell and Dangling Rope Marina. This storm will be capable of producing strong gusty winds on Lake Powell. This will lead to a sudden increase in waves and very choppy waters which will result in hazardous boating conditions. Boaters are urged to seek safe harbor if possible. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
